question_stem.en: A 35-year-old, right-handed mechanic comes to the clinic due to progressive right hand weakness. The patient frequently uses a screwdriver at work. Neurologic examination shows preserved sensation in the upper limbs. There is weakness on extension of the fingers and thumb in the right hand. Strength is otherwise intact. Triceps reflexes are 2+ and bilaterally symmetric. The nerve affected in this patient was most likely injured at which of the following locations?
question_stem.zh: 一名35岁的右利手机械工因进行性右手无力前来就诊。患者在工作中经常使用螺丝刀。神经系统检查显示上肢感觉保留。右手手指和拇指伸展无力。其他力量完好。肱三头肌反射2+，双侧对称。该患者受累的神经最有可能在以下哪个部位受伤？

question.en: The nerve affected in this patient was most likely injured at which of the following locations?
question.zh: 该患者受累的神经最有可能在以下哪个部位受伤？

explanation.en:
Injury to the deep branch of the radial nerve at the supinator muscle may occur due to repetitive pronation/supination of the forearm (eg, frequent screwdriver use), direct trauma, or dislocation of the head of the radius. Patients typically have weakness on finger and thumb extension (ie, finger drop). The triceps brachii (responsible for elbow extension and triceps reflex) and extensor carpi radialis longus (responsible for wrist extension) are typically unaffected because the branches supplying these muscles diverge proximal to the supinator muscle. Cutaneous sensory branches are similarly preserved. {{exhibit_1}}

(Choices A and E) Injury to the radial nerve at the axilla (eg, crutch palsy) typically causes weakness of the forearm, hand, and finger extensor muscles (eg, wrist drop) with absent triceps reflex and sensory loss over the posterior arm, forearm, and dorsolateral hand. Injury to the nerve at the humeral midshaft along the spiral groove usually causes similar forearm/hand deficits with sparing of the triceps muscle.

(Choice B) Carpal tunnel syndrome can result from any condition that reduces the size of the carpal tunnel and compresses the median nerve (eg, pregnancy, hypothyroidism). Patients typically have pain/paresthesia affecting the first 3 and a half digits along with thenar atrophy and thumb abduction/opposition weakness as the disease progresses.

(Choice C) The coracobrachialis muscle lies deep to the biceps brachii and is innervated by the musculocutaneous nerve. Injury to the musculocutaneous nerve may result in decreased strength on forearm flexion and sensory loss over the lateral forearm.

(Choice D) In the wrist, the ulnar nerve passes between the hook of hamate and the pisiform bone in the Guyon canal. Ulnar nerve injury at this site can cause weakness on finger abduction/adduction and clawing of the fourth and fifth digits.

Educational objective:
Injury to the radial nerve at the supinator muscle may occur due to repetitive pronation/supination of the forearm, direct trauma, or subluxation of the radius. Patients typically have weakness during finger and thumb extension (ie, finger drop) without wrist drop or sensory deficits. {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}}
explanation.zh:
桡神经深支在旋后肌处受伤可能是由于前臂的重复旋前/旋后（例如，频繁使用螺丝刀）、直接创伤或桡骨头脱位所致。患者通常出现手指和拇指伸展无力（即，手指下垂）。肱三头肌（负责肘伸展和肱三头肌反射）和桡侧腕长伸肌（负责腕伸展）通常不受影响，因为支配这些肌肉的神经分支在旋后肌近端分叉。皮肤感觉支也同样保留。 {{exhibit_1}}

（选项A和E）腋窝处（例如，拐杖麻痹）桡神经损伤通常会导致前臂、手和手指伸肌无力（例如，腕下垂），伴有肱三头肌反射消失和后臂、前臂和手背外侧感觉丧失。肱骨中段沿螺旋沟的神经损伤通常会导致类似的前臂/手缺陷，但肱三头肌不受影响。

（选项B）腕管综合征可由任何导致腕管大小减小并压迫正中神经的疾病引起（例如，妊娠、甲状腺功能减退症）。患者通常会出现影响前3个半手指的疼痛/感觉异常，以及鱼际萎缩和拇指外展/对掌无力，随着疾病的进展。

（选项C）喙肱肌位于肱二头肌深部，由肌皮神经支配。肌皮神经损伤可能导致前臂屈曲力量下降和前臂外侧感觉丧失。

（选项D）在腕部，尺神经在钩骨和豌豆骨之间的Guyon管中通过。该部位的尺神经损伤可导致手指外展/内收无力和第四、第五指的爪形指。

教学目标：
旋后肌处桡神经损伤可能是由于前臂的重复旋前/旋后、直接创伤或桡骨半脱位所致。患者通常在手指和拇指伸展时出现无力（即，手指下垂），但没有腕下垂或感觉缺失。{{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of radial nerve anatomy and the clinical presentation of posterior interosseous nerve (PIN) syndrome. Specifically, it assesses the ability to differentiate PIN syndrome from other radial nerve injuries and conditions affecting hand function. 

To solve this question, recognize the patient's repetitive screwdriver use as a risk factor for PIN syndrome. Identify the key finding of finger and thumb extension weakness with preserved sensation and triceps function. Recall that the PIN is a branch of the radial nerve that innervates the finger and thumb extensors after branching off proximal to the wrist, and is susceptible to injury at the supinator muscle.
summary.zh:
本题考察了桡神经解剖学知识以及后骨间神经 (PIN) 综合征的临床表现。具体而言，它评估了区分 PIN 综合征与其他桡神经损伤以及影响手部功能的病症的能力。

要解决这个问题，需要认识到患者重复使用螺丝刀是 PIN 综合征的危险因素。确定手指和拇指伸展无力、感觉和肱三头肌功能保留的关键发现。回想一下，PIN 是桡神经的一个分支，在从腕部近端分出后支配手指和拇指伸肌，并且容易在旋后肌处受伤。

tags: Radial nerve; Posterior interosseous nerve; Supinator muscle; Nerve entrapment; Finger drop; Hand weakness; Musculoskeletal; Occupational injury; Peripheral neuropathy
